name: anomaly_cdays_temp_max_ne_mun_month
title: anomaly_max_temp_NE_mun_month_vec
description: This represents the maximum temperature anomaly, which is defined as the number of consecutive days during which the maximum temperature exceeds the maximum temperature of the climatological norm. This data has been aggregated by municipality and month to northeast

bands.name: GEOTIFF
bands.description: This is the data in a GeoTIFF in a Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG) format

bands.name: TABULAR
bands.description: This is the data in a tabular format

bands.name: THUMBNAIL
bands.description: This is the quicklook of data

bands.name: GEOJSON
bands.description: This is the data in a geospatial format

bands.name: SHAPEFILE
bands.description: This is the data in a shapefile format

descriptions.description: This represents the maximum temperature anomaly, which is defined as the number of consecutive days during which the maximum temperature exceeds the maximum temperature of the climatological norm. This data has been aggregated by municipality and month to northeast

providers.name: Data from Era5-Land (Copernicus) produced by Raphael Saldanha (Associated Researcher / Fiocruz)

providers.processing:lineage: Generation of spatialized climate data published on Geoserver as vector layers
